wikipedia_page.main: Harry Gilbey was a British actor who appeared in more than fifty films during the silent era including After Dark (1915).

response: | Kissing Cup || Jack Hulcup || Harry Gilbey, Chrissie White, Cecil Mannering || Sports ||
* Harry Gilbey as Lord George Gordon

* Harry Gilbey as Duke of Argyll
* Harry Gilbey as Sir William Thornhill

Kissing Cup is a 1913 British silent sports film directed by  Jack Hulcup and starring Harry Gilbey, Chrissie White and Cecil Mannering.Palmer p.874 The film's title is an allusion to the poem Kissing Cup's Race by Campbell Rae Brown. A jockey manages to escape a gang of kidnappers and makes it to Sandown in time to win his race.

After Dark is a 1915 British silent crime film directed by Warwick Buckland and starring Flora Morris, Harry Royston and Harry Gilbey.Goble p. 49 It is an adaptation of the 1868 play of the same name by Dion Boucicault.
A Park Lane Scandal is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by Warwick Buckland and starring Flora Morris, Joseph R. Tozer and Harry Gilbey.Palmer p.349
* Harry Gilbey as The Rich Man
